com.inqwell.any

Class AbstractResourceAllocator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.inqwell.any.AbstractAny
      • com.inqwell.any.AbstractResourceAllocator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Any, ResourceAllocator, Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConnectManager, InqIoManager, ServerConnectionManager, SqlManager

    public abstract class AbstractResourceAllocator
extends AbstractAny
implements ResourceAllocator

      • getSpec

        public Any getSpec(Any id)
        Description copied from interface: ResourceAllocator
        Fetch the configuration information for this resource id. The information returned depends on the implementation. For a pool of SQL connections there may be login details together with any aspects of how the JDBC driver behaves.
        Specified by:
        getSpec in interface ResourceAllocator
        Returns:
        The configuration information, typically a Map

      • acquire

            throws AnyException
        Description copied from interface: ResourceAllocator
        Acquire, or wait indefinitely until available for, the resource identified by the given identifier.
        Specified by:
        acquire in interface ResourceAllocator
        Throws:
        AnyException

      • acquire

        public Any acquire(Any id,
                   long timeout)
            throws AnyException
        Description copied from interface: ResourceAllocator
        Acquire for the current process, waiting at most the specified time for, the resource identified by the given identifier.
        Specified by:
        acquire in interface ResourceAllocator
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of the resource being acquired
        timeout - the amount of time, in ms, to wait for the resource to become available. -1 is an indefinite wait.
        Returns:
        the acquired resource
        Throws:
        AnyException - if no resource became available in the finite wait time or none could be made.

      • acquire

        public Any acquire(Any id,
                   Process acquirer,
                   long timeout)
            throws AnyException
        Description copied from interface: ResourceAllocator
        Acquire, for the specified Process, waiting at most the specified time for, the resource identified by the given identifier.
        Specified by:
        acquire in interface ResourceAllocator
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of the resource being acquired
        acquirer - the Process acquiring the resource
        timeout - the amount of time, in ms, to wait for the resource to become available. -1 is an indefinite wait.
        Returns:
        the acquired resource
        Throws:
        AnyException - if no resource became available in the finite wait time or none could be made.

      • release

        public void release(Any id,
                    Any resource,
                    Any arg,
                    ExceptionContainer e)
             throws AnyException
        Description copied from interface: ResourceAllocator
        Release the given resource. It is undefined what happens if the id is not the same as the one used to acquire the resource. The current process is assumed to be the present owner of the resource.
        Specified by:
        release in interface ResourceAllocator
        Throws:
        AnyException

      • release

        public void release(Any id,
                    Process releaser,
                    Any resource,
                    Any arg,
                    ExceptionContainer e)
             throws AnyException
        Description copied from interface: ResourceAllocator
        Release the given resource. It is undefined what happens if the id is not the same as the one used to acquire the resource.

        Releasing a resource may involve exception-prone operations, for example an SQL connection committing a transaction. Implementations may choose to throw or return any such exception via the ExceptionContainer argument.

        Specified by:
        release in interface ResourceAllocator
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of the resource being released
        releaser - current owner of the resource.
        arg - an additional argument that can be used by implementations as required
        e - an ExceptionContainer through which an exception occurring during release may be returned.
        Throws:
        AnyException

      • deleteAll

        public void deleteAll(Any spec)
               throws AnyException
        Throws:
        AnyException

      • getResourcesMade

        public int getResourcesMade(Any spec)
        Description copied from interface: ResourceAllocator
        Returns the number of resources currently available for allocation, whether or not they are currently allocated to a user.
        Specified by:
        getResourcesMade in interface ResourceAllocator
        Returns:
        the number of resources available, or zero if none have been created or the specification is unknown.

      • makeNewResource

        protected abstract Any makeNewResource(Any id,
                                       Any spec,
                                       int made)
                                throws AnyException
        Make a new resource according to the supplied specification for immediate or later allocation.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of this resource pool
        spec - some information to configure the new resource
        Returns:
        the new resource ready to use
        Throws:
        AnyException

      • beforeRelease

        protected abstract boolean beforeRelease(Any resource,
                                         Any arg,
                                         ExceptionContainer e)
        Check the resource is still OK for re-use. If not then AbstractResourceAllocator will not put it back in the pool for future allocation and will decrement the count of resources available so that the resource will be allocated again sometime in the future.

      • beforeAcquire

        protected abstract boolean beforeAcquire(Any resource)

      • afterAcquire

        protected abstract void afterAcquire(Any resource)

      • disposeResource

        protected abstract void disposeResource(Any resource)
        Called if the resource is to be disposed of. This can be due to beforeRelease returning false or ResourceAllocator finalization
